 1	from typing import Annotated
 2	from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
 3	from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
 4	from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Path, Request, status
 5	from starlette import status
 6	from models import Todos
 7	from database import SessionLocal
 8	from auth import get_current_user
 9	from starlette.responses import RedirectResponse
 10	from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates
 11	
 12	templates = Jinja2Templates(directory="TodoApp/templates")
 13	
 14	router = APIRouter(
 15	 prefix='/todos',
 16	 tags=['todos']
 17	)
 18	
 19	
 20	def get_db():
 21	 db = SessionLocal()
 22	 try:
 23	 yield db
 24	 finally:
 25	 db.close()
 26	
 27	
 28	db_dependency = Annotated[Session, Depends(get_db)]
 29	user_dependency = Annotated[dict, Depends(get_current_user)]
 30	
 31	
 32	class TodoRequest(BaseModel):
 33	 title: str = Field(min_length=3)
 34	 description: str = Field(min_length=3, max_length=100)
 35	 priority: int = Field(gt=0, lt=6)
 36	 complete: bool
 37	
 38	
 39	def redirect_to_login():
 40	 redirect_response = RedirectResponse(url="/auth/login-page", status_code=status.HTTP_302_FOUND)
 41	 redirect_response.delete_cookie(key="access_token")
 42	 return redirect_response
 43	
 44	
 45	### Pages ###
 46	
 47	@router.get("/todo-page")
 48	async def render_todo_page(request: Request, db: db_dependency):
 49	 try:
 50	 user = await get_current_user(request.cookies.get('access_token'))
 51	
 52	 if user is None:
 53	 return redirect_to_login()
 54	
 55	 todos = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get("id")).all()
 56	
 57	 return templates.TemplateResponse("todo.html", {"request": request, "todos": todos, "user": user})
 58	
 59	 except:
 60	 return redirect_to_login()
 61	
 62	
 63	@router.get('/add-todo-page')
 64	async def render_todo_page(request: Request):
 65	 try:
 66	 user = await get_current_user(request.cookies.get('access_token'))
 67	
 68	 if user is None:
 69	 return redirect_to_login()
 70	
 71	 return templates.TemplateResponse("add-todo.html", {"request": request, "user": user})
 72	
 73	 except:
 74	 return redirect_to_login()
 75	
 76	
 77	@router.get("/edit-todo-page/{todo_id}")
 78	async def render_edit_todo_page(request: Request, todo_id: int, db: db_dependency):
 79	 try:
 80	 user = await get_current_user(request.cookies.get('access_token'))
 81	
 82	 if user is None:
 83	 return redirect_to_login()
 84	
 85	 todo = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id).first()
 86	
 87	 return templates.TemplateResponse("edit-todo.html", {"request": request, "todo": todo, "user": user})
 88	
 89	 except:
 90	 return redirect_to_login()
 91	
 92	
 93	
 94	### Endpoints ###
 95	@router.get("/", status_code=status.HTTP_200_OK)
 96	async def read_all(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency):
 97	 if user is None:
 98	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 99	 return db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).all()
 100	
 101	
 102	@router.get("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_200_OK)
 103	async def read_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency, todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 104	 if user is None:
 105	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 106	
 107	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id)\
 108	 .filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).first()
 109	 if todo_model is not None:
 110	 return todo_model
 111	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 112	
 113	
 114	@router.post("/todo", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
 115	async def create_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 116	 todo_request: TodoRequest):
 117	 if user is None:
 118	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 119	 todo_model = Todos(**todo_request.model_dump(), owner_id=user.get('id'))
 120	
 121	 db.add(todo_model)
 122	 db.commit()
 123	
 124	
 125	@router.put("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 126	async def update_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 127	 todo_request: TodoRequest,
 128	 todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 129	 if user is None:
 130	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 131	
 132	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id)\
 133	 .filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).first()
 134	 if todo_model is None:
 135	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 136	
 137	 todo_model.title = todo_request.title
 138	 todo_model.description = todo_request.description
 139	 todo_model.priority = todo_request.priority
 140	 todo_model.complete = todo_request.complete
 141	
 142	 db.add(todo_model)
 143	 db.commit()
 144	
 145	
 146	@router.delete("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 147	async def delete_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency, todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 148	 if user is None:
 149	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 150	
 151	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id)\
 152	 .filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).first()
 153	 if todo_model is None:
 154	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 155	 db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id).filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).delete()
 156	
 157	 db.commit()

Path: routers/auth.py
 1	from datetime import timedelta, datetime, timezone
 2	from typing import Annotated
 3	from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Request
 4	from pydantic import BaseModel
 5	from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
 6	from starlette import status
 7	from database import SessionLocal
 8	from models import Users
 9	from passlib.context import CryptContext
 10	from fastapi.security import OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, OAuth2PasswordBearer
 11	from jose import jwt, JWTError
 12	from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates
 13	
 14	router = APIRouter(
 15	 prefix='/auth',
 16	 tags=['auth']
 17	)
 18	
 19	SECRET_KEY = '197b2c37c391bed93fe80344fe73b806947a65e36206e05a1a23c2fa12702fe3'
 20	ALGORITHM = 'HS256'
 21	
 22	bcrypt_context = CryptContext(schemes=['bcrypt'], deprecated='auto')
 23	oauth2_bearer = OAuth2PasswordBearer(tokenUrl='auth/token')
 24	
 25	
 26	class CreateUserRequest(BaseModel):
 27	 username: str
 28	 email: str
 29	 first_name: str
 30	 last_name: str
 31	 password: str
 32	 role: str
 33	 phone_number: str
 34	
 35	
 36	class Token(BaseModel):
 37	 access_token: str
 38	 token_type: str
 39	
 40	
 41	def get_db():
 42	 db = SessionLocal()
 43	 try:
 44	 yield db
 45	 finally:
 46	 db.close()
 47	
 48	
 49	db_dependency = Annotated[Session, Depends(get_db)]
 50	
 51	templates = Jinja2Templates(directory="TodoApp/templates")
 52	
 53	
 54	### Pages ###
 55	
 56	@router.get("/login-page")
 57	def render_login_page(request: Request):
 58	 return templates.TemplateResponse("login.html", {"request": request})
 59	
 60	@router.get("/register-page")
 61	def render_register_page(request: Request):
 62	 return templates.TemplateResponse("register.html", {"request": request})
 63	
 64	### Endpoints ###
 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
 79	
 80	
 81	async def get_current_user(token: Annotated[str, Depends(oauth2_bearer)]):
 82	 try:
 83	 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 84	 username: str = payload.get('sub')

 11	router = APIRouter(

 30	class UserVerification(BaseModel):

 36	async def get_user(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency):
 37	 if user is None:

 42	@router.put("/password", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 43	async def change_password(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 44	 user_verification: UserVerification):
 45	 if user is None:
 46	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 47	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 48	
 49	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(user_verification.password, user_model.hashed_password):
 50	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Error on password change')
 51	 user_model.hashed_password = bcrypt_context.hash(user_verification.new_password)
 52	 db.add(user_model)
 53	 db.commit()
 54	
 55	
 56	@router.put("/phonenumber/{phone_number}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 57	async def change_phonenumber(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 58	 phone_number: str):
 59	 if user is None:
 60	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 61	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 62	 user_model.phone_number = phone_number
 63	 db.add(user_model)

 35	@router.get('/', status_code=status.HTTP_200_OK)
 36	async def get_user(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency):

 41	
 42	@router.put("/password", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 43	async def change_password(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 44	 user_verification: UserVerification):
 45	 if user is None:
 46	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 47	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 48	
 49	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(user_verification.password, user_model.hashed_password):
 50	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Error on password change')
 51	 user_model.hashed_password = bcrypt_context.hash(user_verification.new_password)
 52	 db.add(user_model)
 53	 db.commit()
 54	
 55	
 56	@router.put("/phonenumber/{phone_number}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)

 58	 phone_number: str):

 60	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 61	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 62	 user_model.phone_number = phone_number
 63	 db.add(user_model)
 64	 db.commit()

 2	from typing import Annotated
 3	from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Request
 4	from pydantic import BaseModel

 12	from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates
 13	
 14	router = APIRouter(
 15	 prefix='/auth',
 16	 tags=['auth']
 17	)
 18	
 19	SECRET_KEY = '197b2c37c391bed93fe80344fe73b806947a65e36206e05a1a23c2fa12702fe3'
 20	ALGORITHM = 'HS256'
 21	
 22	bcrypt_context = CryptContext(schemes=['bcrypt'], deprecated='auto')
 23	oauth2_bearer = OAuth2PasswordBearer(tokenUrl='auth/token')
 24	
 25	
 26	class CreateUserRequest(BaseModel):
 27	 username: str
 28	 email: str
 29	 first_name: str
 30	 last_name: str
 31	 password: str
 32	 role: str
 33	 phone_number: str
 34	
 35	
 36	class Token(BaseModel):
 37	 access_token: str
 38	 token_type: str
 39	
 40	
 41	def get_db():
 42	 db = SessionLocal()
 43	 try:
 44	 yield db
 45	 finally:
 46	 db.close()

 48

 53	
 54	### Pages ###
 55	
 56	@router.get("/login-page")
 57	def render_login_page(request: Request):
 58	 return templates.TemplateResponse("login.html", {"request": request})
 59	
 60	@router.get("/register-page")
 61	def render_register_page(request: Request):
 62	 return templates.TemplateResponse("register.html", {"request": request})

 64	### Endpoints ###
 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
 79	
 80	
 81	async def get_current_user(token: Annotated[str, Depends(oauth2_bearer)]):
 82	 try:
 83	 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 84	 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 85	 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 86	 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 87	 if username is None or user_id is None:
 88	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 89	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 90	 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 91	 except JWTError:
 92	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 93	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 94	
 95	
 96	@router.post("/", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
 97	async def create_user(db: db_dependency,
 98	 create_user_request: CreateUserRequest):
 99	 create_user_model = Users(
 100	 email=create_user_request.email,
 101	 username=create_user_request.username,
 102	 first_name=create_user_request.first_name,
 103	 last_name=create_user_request.last_name,
 104	 role=create_user_request.role,
 105	 hashed_password=bcrypt_context.hash(create_user_request.password),
 106	 is_active=True,
 107	 phone_number=create_user_request.phone_number
 108	 )
 109	
 110	 db.add(create_user_model)
 111	 db.commit()
 112	
 113	
 114	@router.post("/token", response_model=Token)
 115	async def login_for_access_token(form_data: Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()],
 116	 db: db_dependency):
 117	 user = authenticate_user(form_data.username, form_data.password, db)
 118	 if not user:
 119	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 120	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 121	 token = create_access_token(user.username, user.id, user.role, timedelta(minutes=20))
 122	
 123	 return {'access_token': token, 'token_type': 'bearer'}

The application is using a hybrid approach where:

1. The login form (via JavaScript) gets a token and stores it in a cookie
2. The page rendering functions try to read the token from the cookie and call `get_current_user` directly
3. But `get_current_user` is designed for OAuth2PasswordBearer dependency injection, not direct token validation

I need to create a separate function for validating tokens from cookies. Let me add this function to the auth.py file:

 220	 // Helper function to get a cookie by name
 221	 function getCookie(name) {
 222	 let cookieValue = null;
 223	 if (document.cookie && document.cookie !== '') {
 224	 const cookies = document.cookie.split(';');
 225	 for (let i = 0; i < cookies.length; i++) {
 226	 const cookie = cookies[i].trim();
 227	 if (cookie.substring(0, name.length + 1) === (name + '=')) {
 228	 cookieValue = decodeURIComponent(cookie.substring(name.length + 1));
 229	 break;
 230	 }
 231	 }
 232	 }
 233	 return cookieValue;
 234	 };
 235	
 236	 function logout() {
 237	 // Get all cookies
 238	 const cookies = document.cookie.split(";");
 239	 
 240	 // Iterate through all cookies and delete each one
 241	 for (let i = 0; i < cookies.length; i++) {
 242	 const cookie = cookies[i];
 243	 const eqPos = cookie.indexOf("=");
 244	 const name = eqPos > -1 ? cookie.substr(0, eqPos) : cookie;
 245	 // Set the cookie's expiry date to a past date to delete it
 246	 document.cookie = name + "=;expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT;path=/";
 247	 }
 248

 250	 window.location.href = '/auth/login-page';

 - Fixed function name conflict (renamed duplicate function name)

### Key Changes Made:

<augment_code_snippet path="routers/auth.py" mode="EXCERPT">
```python
async def get_current_user_from_token(token: str):
 """
 Validate user from token string (for cookie-based authentication)
 """
 try:
 if token is None:
 return None
 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 if username is None or user_id is None:
 return None
 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 except JWTError:
 return None
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The application is now running successfully on `http://0.0.0.0:8000` without any import or path errors. The authentication system properly handles both OAuth2 bearer tokens (for API endpoints) and cookie-based authentication (for web pages).

````python path=routers/auth.py mode=EXCERPT
async def get_current_user_from_token(token: str):
 """
 Validate user from token string (for cookie-based authentication)
 """
 try:
 if token is None:
 return None
 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 if username is None or user_id is None:
 return None
 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 except JWTError:
 return None
````

````python path=routers/auth.py mode=EXCERPT
 Validate user from token string (for cookie-based authentication)
 """
 try:
 if token is None:
 return None
 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 if username is None or user_id is None:
 return None
 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 except JWTError:
 return None
````

 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
 79	
 80	
 81	async def get_current_user(token: Annotated[str, Depends(oauth2_bearer)]):
 82	 try:
 83	 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 84	 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 85	 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 86	 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 87	 if username is None or user_id is None:
 88	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 89	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 90	 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 91	 except JWTError:
 92	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 93	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 94	
 95	
 96	@router.post("/", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
 97	async def create_user(db: db_dependency,
 98	 create_user_request: CreateUserRequest):
 99	 create_user_model = Users(
 100	 email=create_user_request.email,
 101	 username=create_user_request.username,
 102	 first_name=create_user_request.first_name,
 103	 last_name=create_user_request.last_name,
 104	 role=create_user_request.role,
 105	 hashed_password=bcrypt_context.hash(create_user_request.password),
 106	 is_active=True,
 107	 phone_number=create_user_request.phone_number
 108	 )
 109	
 110	 db.add(create_user_model)
 111	 db.commit()
 112	
 113	
 114	@router.post("/token", response_model=Token)
 115	async def login_for_access_token(form_data: Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()],
 116	 db: db_dependency):
 117	 user = authenticate_user(form_data.username, form_data.password, db)
 118	 if not user:
 119	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 120	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 121	 token = create_access_token(user.username, user.id, user.role, timedelta(minutes=20))
 122	
 123	 return {'access_token': token, 'token_type': 'bearer'}

 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
 79	
 80	
 81	async def get_current_user(token: Annotated[str, Depends(oauth2_bearer)]):
 82	 try:
 83	 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 84	 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 85	 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 86	 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 87	 if username is None or user_id is None:
 88	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 89	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 90	 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 91	 except JWTError:
 92	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 93	 detail='Could not validate user.')

 116	 db: db_dependency):
 117	 user = authenticate_user(form_data.username, form_data.password, db)
 118	 if not user:

 120	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 121	 token = create_access_token(user.username, user.id, user.role, timedelta(minutes=20))
 122

 11	from jose import jwt, JWTError
 12	from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates

 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)

 35	@router.delete("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 36	async def delete_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency, todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 37	 if user is None or user.get('user_role') != 'admin':
 38	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 39	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id).first()
 40	 if todo_model is None:
 41	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 42	 db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id).delete()
 43	 db.commit()

 1	from typing import Annotated
 2	from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
 3	from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
 4	from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Path
 5	from starlette import status
 6	from models import Users
 7	from database import SessionLocal
 8	from routers.auth import get_current_user
 9	from passlib.context import CryptContext
 10	
 11	router = APIRouter(
 12	 prefix='/user',
 13	 tags=['user']
 14	)
 15	
 16	
 17	def get_db():
 18	 db = SessionLocal()
 19	 try:
 20	 yield db
 21	 finally:
 22	 db.close()
 23	
 24	
 25	db_dependency = Annotated[Session, Depends(get_db)]
 26	user_dependency = Annotated[dict, Depends(get_current_user)]
 27	bcrypt_context = CryptContext(schemes=['bcrypt'], deprecated='auto')
 28	
 29	
 30	class UserVerification(BaseModel):
 31	 password: str
 32	 new_password: str = Field(min_length=6)
 33	
 34	
 35	@router.get('/', status_code=status.HTTP_200_OK)
 36	async def get_user(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency):
 37	 if user is None:
 38	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 39	 return db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 40	
 41	
 42	@router.put("/password", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 43	async def change_password(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 44	 user_verification: UserVerification):
 45	 if user is None:
 46	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 47	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 48	
 49	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(user_verification.password, user_model.hashed_password):
 50	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Error on password change')
 51	 user_model.hashed_password = bcrypt_context.hash(user_verification.new_password)
 52	 db.add(user_model)
 53	 db.commit()
 54	
 55	
 56	@router.put("/phonenumber/{phone_number}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 57	async def change_phonenumber(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 58	 phone_number: str):
 59	 if user is None:
 60	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 61	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 62	 user_model.phone_number = phone_number
 63	 db.add(user_model)
 64	 db.commit()

 1	from typing import Annotated
 2	from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
 3	from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
 4	from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Path, Request, status
 5	from starlette import status
 6	from models import Todos
 7	from database import SessionLocal
 8	from routers.auth import get_current_user
 9	from starlette.responses import RedirectResponse
 10	from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates
 11	
 12	templates = Jinja2Templates(directory="templates")
 13	
 14	router = APIRouter(
 15	 prefix='/todos',
 16	 tags=['todos']
 17	)
 18	
 19	
 20	def get_db():
 21	 db = SessionLocal()
 22	 try:
 23	 yield db
 24	 finally:
 25	 db.close()
 26	
 27	
 28	db_dependency = Annotated[Session, Depends(get_db)]
 29	user_dependency = Annotated[dict, Depends(get_current_user)]
 30	
 31	
 32	class TodoRequest(BaseModel):
 33	 title: str = Field(min_length=3)
 34	 description: str = Field(min_length=3, max_length=100)
 35	 priority: int = Field(gt=0, lt=6)
 36	 complete: bool
 37	
 38	
 39	def redirect_to_login():
 40	 redirect_response = RedirectResponse(url="/auth/login-page", status_code=status.HTTP_302_FOUND)
 41	 redirect_response.delete_cookie(key="access_token")
 42	 return redirect_response
 43	
 44	
 45	### Pages ###
 46	
 47	@router.get("/todo-page")
 48	async def render_todo_page(request: Request, db: db_dependency):
 49	 try:
 50	 user = await get_current_user(request.cookies.get('access_token'))
 51	
 52	 if user is None:
 53	 return redirect_to_login()
 54	
 55	 todos = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get("id")).all()
 56	
 57	 return templates.TemplateResponse("todo.html", {"request": request, "todos": todos, "user": user})
 58	
 59	 except:
 60	 return redirect_to_login()
 61	
 62	
 63	@router.get('/add-todo-page')
 64	async def render_todo_page(request: Request):
 65	 try:
 66	 user = await get_current_user(request.cookies.get('access_token'))
 67	
 68	 if user is None:
 69	 return redirect_to_login()
 70	
 71	 return templates.TemplateResponse("add-todo.html", {"request": request, "user": user})
 72	
 73	 except:
 74	 return redirect_to_login()
 75	
 76	
 77	@router.get("/edit-todo-page/{todo_id}")
 78	async def render_edit_todo_page(request: Request, todo_id: int, db: db_dependency):
 79	 try:
 80	 user = await get_current_user(request.cookies.get('access_token'))
 81	
 82	 if user is None:
 83	 return redirect_to_login()
 84	
 85	 todo = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id).first()
 86	
 87	 return templates.TemplateResponse("edit-todo.html", {"request": request, "todo": todo, "user": user})
 88	
 89	 except:
 90	 return redirect_to_login()
 91	
 92

 95	@router.get("/", status_code=status.HTTP_200_OK)
 96	async def read_all(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency):
 97	 if user is None:
 98	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 99	 return db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).all()
 100	
 101	
 102	@router.get("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_200_OK)
 103	async def read_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency, todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 104	 if user is None:
 105	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 106	
 107	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id)\
 108	 .filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).first()
 109	 if todo_model is not None:
 110	 return todo_model
 111	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 112	
 113	
 114	@router.post("/todo", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
 115	async def create_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 116	 todo_request: TodoRequest):
 117	 if user is None:
 118	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 119	 todo_model = Todos(**todo_request.model_dump(), owner_id=user.get('id'))
 120	
 121	 db.add(todo_model)
 122	 db.commit()
 123	
 124	
 125	@router.put("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 126	async def update_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 127	 todo_request: TodoRequest,
 128	 todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 129	 if user is None:
 130	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 131	
 132	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id)\
 133	 .filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).first()
 134	 if todo_model is None:
 135	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 136	
 137	 todo_model.title = todo_request.title
 138	 todo_model.description = todo_request.description
 139	 todo_model.priority = todo_request.priority
 140	 todo_model.complete = todo_request.complete
 141	
 142	 db.add(todo_model)
 143	 db.commit()
 144	
 145	
 146	@router.delete("/todo/{todo_id}", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
 147	async def delete_todo(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency, todo_id: int = Path(gt=0)):
 148	 if user is None:
 149	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 150	
 151	 todo_model = db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id)\
 152	 .filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).first()
 153	 if todo_model is None:
 154	 raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail='Todo not found.')
 155	 db.query(Todos).filter(Todos.id == todo_id).filter(Todos.owner_id == user.get('id')).delete()
 156	
 157	 db.commit()

 30	class UserVerification(BaseModel):

 43	async def change_password(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 44	 user_verification: UserVerification):
 45	 if user is None:
 46	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 47	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 48	
 49	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(user_verification.password, user_model.hashed_password):
 50	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Error on password change')
 51	 user_model.hashed_password = bcrypt_context.hash(user_verification.new_password)
 52	 db.add(user_model)
 53	 db.commit()

 2	from typing import Annotated
 3	from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Request

 13	
 14	router = APIRouter(

 18

 20	ALGORITHM = 'HS256'
 21	
 22	bcrypt_context = CryptContext(schemes=['bcrypt'], deprecated='auto')
 23	oauth2_bearer = OAuth2PasswordBearer(tokenUrl='auth/token')
 24	
 25	
 26	class CreateUserRequest(BaseModel):
 27	 username: str
 28	 email: str
 29	 first_name: str
 30	 last_name: str
 31	 password: str
 32	 role: str
 33	 phone_number: str
 34	
 35

 37	 access_token: str

 40	
 41	def get_db():

 46	 db.close()

 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
 79	
 80	
 81	async def get_current_user(token: Annotated[str, Depends(oauth2_bearer)]):
 82	 try:
 83	 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 84	 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 85	 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 86	 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 87	 if username is None or user_id is None:
 88	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 89	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 90	 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 91	 except JWTError:
 92	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 93	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 94	
 95	
 96	@router.post("/", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
 97	async def create_user(db: db_dependency,
 98	 create_user_request: CreateUserRequest):
 99	 create_user_model = Users(
 100	 email=create_user_request.email,
 101	 username=create_user_request.username,
 102	 first_name=create_user_request.first_name,
 103	 last_name=create_user_request.last_name,
 104	 role=create_user_request.role,
 105	 hashed_password=bcrypt_context.hash(create_user_request.password),
 106	 is_active=True,
 107	 phone_number=create_user_request.phone_number
 108	 )
 109	
 110	 db.add(create_user_model)
 111	 db.commit()
 112	
 113	
 114	@router.post("/token", response_model=Token)
 115	async def login_for_access_token(form_data: Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()],
 116	 db: db_dependency):
 117	 user = authenticate_user(form_data.username, form_data.password, db)
 118	 if not user:
 119	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 120	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 121	 token = create_access_token(user.username, user.id, user.role, timedelta(minutes=20))
 122	
 123	 return {'access_token': token, 'token_type': 'bearer'}
 124

 10	def test_authenticate_user(test_user):

 33	 options={'verify_signature': False})
 34	
 35	 assert decoded_token['sub'] == username
 36	 assert decoded_token['id'] == user_id
 37	 assert decoded_token['role'] == role

 60	@router.get("/register-page")
 61	def render_register_page(request: Request):
 62	 return templates.TemplateResponse("register.html", {"request": request})
 63	
 64	### Endpoints ###
 65	def authenticate_user(username: str, password: str, db):
 66	 user = db.query(Users).filter(Users.username == username).first()
 67	 if not user:
 68	 return False
 69	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(password, user.hashed_password):
 70	 return False
 71	 return user
 72	
 73	
 74	def create_access_token(username: str, user_id: int, role: str, expires_delta: timedelta):
 75	 encode = {'sub': username, 'id': user_id, 'role': role}
 76	 expires = datetime.now(timezone.utc) + expires_delta
 77	 encode.update({'exp': expires})
 78	 return jwt.encode(encode, SECRET_KEY, algorithm=ALGORITHM)
 79	
 80	
 81	async def get_current_user(token: Annotated[str, Depends(oauth2_bearer)]):
 82	 try:
 83	 payload = jwt.decode(token, SECRET_KEY, algorithms=[ALGORITHM])
 84	 username: str = payload.get('sub')
 85	 user_id: int = payload.get('id')
 86	 user_role: str = payload.get('role')
 87	 if username is None or user_id is None:
 88	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 89	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 90	 return {'username': username, 'id': user_id, 'user_role': user_role}
 91	 except JWTError:
 92	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 93	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 94	
 95	
 96	@router.post("/", status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
 97	async def create_user(db: db_dependency,
 98	 create_user_request: CreateUserRequest):
 99	 create_user_model = Users(
 100	 email=create_user_request.email,
 101	 username=create_user_request.username,
 102	 first_name=create_user_request.first_name,
 103	 last_name=create_user_request.last_name,
 104	 role=create_user_request.role,
 105	 hashed_password=bcrypt_context.hash(create_user_request.password),
 106	 is_active=True,
 107	 phone_number=create_user_request.phone_number
 108	 )
 109	
 110	 db.add(create_user_model)
 111	 db.commit()
 112	
 113	
 114	@router.post("/token", response_model=Token)
 115	async def login_for_access_token(form_data: Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()],
 116	 db: db_dependency):
 117	 user = authenticate_user(form_data.username, form_data.password, db)
 118	 if not user:
 119	 raise HTTPException(status_code=status.HTTP_401_UNAUTHORIZED,
 120	 detail='Could not validate user.')
 121	 token = create_access_token(user.username, user.id, user.role, timedelta(minutes=20))
 122	
 123	 return {'access_token': token, 'token_type': 'bearer'}

 220	 // Helper function to get a cookie by name
 221	 function getCookie(name) {
 222	 let cookieValue = null;
 223	 if (document.cookie && document.cookie !== '') {
 224	 const cookies = document.cookie.split(';');
 225	 for (let i = 0; i < cookies.length; i++) {
 226	 const cookie = cookies[i].trim();
 227	 if (cookie.substring(0, name.length + 1) === (name + '=')) {
 228	 cookieValue = decodeURIComponent(cookie.substring(name.length + 1));
 229	 break;
 230	 }
 231	 }
 232	 }
 233	 return cookieValue;
 234	 };
 235	
 236	 function logout() {
 237	 // Get all cookies
 238	 const cookies = document.cookie.split(";");
 239	 
 240	 // Iterate through all cookies and delete each one
 241	 for (let i = 0; i < cookies.length; i++) {
 242	 const cookie = cookies[i];
 243	 const eqPos = cookie.indexOf("=");
 244	 const name = eqPos > -1 ? cookie.substr(0, eqPos) : cookie;
 245	 // Set the cookie's expiry date to a past date to delete it
 246	 document.cookie = name + "=;expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT;path=/";
 247	 }
 248	 
 249	 // Redirect to the login page
 250	 window.location.href = '/auth/login-page';
 251	 };...

 43	async def change_password(user: user_dependency, db: db_dependency,
 44	 user_verification: UserVerification):
 45	 if user is None:
 46	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Authentication Failed')
 47	 user_model = db.query(Users).filter(Users.id == user.get('id')).first()
 48	
 49	 if not bcrypt_context.verify(user_verification.password, user_model.hashed_password):
 50	 raise HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Error on password change')
 51	 user_model.hashed_password = bcrypt_context.hash(user_verification.new_password)
 52	 db.add(user_model)
 53	 db.commit()

package"},{"type":"hardBreak"}]}]},"mentioned_items":[],"structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"The issue is with relative imports in your `main.py` file. When running FastAPI directly with `fastapi dev main.py`, the file is executed as a script, not as a module, so relative imports don't work.

Fix the imports in `main.py`:

<augment_code_snippet path="main.py" mode="EDIT">
```python
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, status
from models import Base
from database import engine
from routers import auth, todos, admin, users
from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles
from fastapi.responses import RedirectResponse
```
</augment_code_snippet>

Also fix the import in `models.py`:

<augment_code_snippet path="models.py" mode="EDIT">
```python
from database import Base
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, Boolean, ForeignKey
```
</augment_code_snippet>

The problem occurs because:
1. `main.py` uses relative imports (`.models`, `.database`, `.routers`)
2. When FastAPI CLI runs `main.py` directly, it's not treated as part of a package
3. Relative imports only work when the file is imported as a module within a package

Use absolute imports instead when running the file directly as the entry point.

"}},{"id":1,"type":4,"ide_state_node":{"workspaceFolders":[{"repositoryRoot":"C:/Users/KerimKarovic/PycharmProjects/FastAPIProject/ToDoApp","folderRoot":"C:/Users/KerimKarovic/PycharmProjects/FastAPIProject/ToDoApp"}],"workspaceFoldersUnchanged":false}}],"timestamp":"2025-08-08T10:54:15.314Z","response_text":"The issue is with relative imports in your `main.py` file. When running FastAPI directly with `fastapi dev main.py`, the file is executed as a script, not as a module, so relative imports don't work.

Fix the imports in `main.py`:

````python path=main.py mode=EDIT
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, status
from models import Base
from database import engine
from routers import auth, todos, admin, users
from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles
from fastapi.responses import RedirectResponse
````

Also fix the import in `models.py`:

````python path=models.py mode=EDIT
from database import Base
from sqlalchemy import Column, Integer, String, Boolean, ForeignKey
````

The problem occurs because:
1. `main.py` uses relative imports (`.models`, `.database`, `.routers`)
2. When FastAPI CLI runs `main.py` directly, it's not treated as part of a package
3. Relative imports only work when the file is imported as a module within a package

Use absolute imports instead when running the file directly as the entry point.

```python
from datetime import timedelta, datetime, timezone
from typing import Annotated
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends, HTTPException, Request

from sqlalchemy.orm import Session
from starlette import status
from database import SessionLocal
from models import Users
from passlib.context import CryptContext
from fastapi.security import OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, OAuth2PasswordBearer
from jose import jwt, JWTError
from fastapi.templating import Jinja2Templates
```
</augment_code_snippet>
